intro: Stachytarpheta arenaria, commonly known as sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in sandy or well-drained soils. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually blue or purple in color, arranged in whorled clusters along the stems. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate saline and drought conditions. Stachytarpheta arenaria is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
